com.deezer.sdk.player

Interface Player


  • public interface Player
    Defines the behavior of a player in Deezer SDK.

    The player is a state machine described by the following schema :

    The player progress and state, as well as its buffer state and progress can be monitored through 6 interfaces :
    • OnBufferErrorListener
    • OnBufferProgressListener
    • OnBufferStateChangeListener
    • OnPlayerErrorListener
    • OnPlayerProgressListener
    • OnPlayerStateChangeListener
    Author:
    Deezer

    • Method Detail

      • getPlayerState

        PlayerState getPlayerState()
        Returns:
        the player's state.

      • setPlayerProgressInterval

        void setPlayerProgressInterval(long interval)
        Sets the interval at which OnPlayerProgressListener are notified.
        Parameters:
        interval - the new interval (in ms).

      • addOnPlayerProgressListener

        void addOnPlayerProgressListener(OnPlayerProgressListener onPlayerProgressListener)
        Adds a OnPlayerProgressListener to the player. It will be notified of the progress of the position of the reading of the currently playing track. The interval of the notifications can be cutsomized.
        Parameters:
        onPlayerProgressListener - the listener to be added.
        See Also:
        setPlayerProgressInterval(long)

      • removeOnPlayerProgressListener

        void removeOnPlayerProgressListener(OnPlayerProgressListener onPlayerProgressListener)
        Removes a OnPlayerProgressListener to the player.
        Parameters:
        onPlayerProgressListener - the listener to be removed.

      • addOnPlayerStateChangeListener

        void addOnPlayerStateChangeListener(OnPlayerStateChangeListener onPlayerStateChangeListener)
        Adds a OnPlayerStateChangeListener to the player. It will be notified of any change of the player's state.
        Parameters:
        onPlayerStateChangeListener - the listener to be added.

      • removeOnPlayerStateChangeListener

        void removeOnPlayerStateChangeListener(OnPlayerStateChangeListener onPlayerStateChangeListener)
        Removes a OnPlayerStateChangeListener to the player.
        Parameters:
        onPlayerStateChangeListener - the listener to be removed.

      • addOnPlayerErrorListener

        void addOnPlayerErrorListener(OnPlayerErrorListener onPlayerErrorListener)
        Adds a OnPlayerErrorListener to the player. It will be notified of any error that occurs inside the player.
        Parameters:
        onPlayerErrorListener - the listener to be added.

      • removeOnPlayerErrorListener

        void removeOnPlayerErrorListener(OnPlayerErrorListener onPlayerErrorListener)
        Removes a OnPlayerErrorListener to the player.
        Parameters:
        onPlayerErrorListener - the listener to be removed.

      • addOnBufferProgressListener

        void addOnBufferProgressListener(OnBufferProgressListener onBufferProgressListener)
        Adds a OnBufferProgressListener to the Buffer. It will be notified of the progress of the position of the reading of the currently playing track. The interval of the notifications can be cutsomized.
        Parameters:
        onBufferProgressListener - the listener to be added.

      • removeOnBufferProgressListener

        Removes a OnBufferProgressListener to the Buffer.

        onBufferProgressListener - the listener to be removed.

      • addOnBufferStateChangeListener

        void addOnBufferStateChangeListener(OnBufferStateChangeListener onBufferStateChangeListener)
        Adds a OnBufferStateChangeListener to the Buffer. It will be notified of any change of the Buffer's state.
        Parameters:
        onBufferStateChangeListener - the listener to be added.

      • addOnBufferErrorListener

        Adds a OnBufferErrorListener to the Buffer. It will be notified of any error that occurs inside the Buffer.
        Parameters:
        onBufferErrorListener - the listener to be added.

        void removeOnBufferErrorListener(OnBufferErrorListener onBufferErrorListener)
        Removes a OnBufferErrorListener to the Buffer.
        Parameters:
        onBufferErrorListener - the listener to be removed.

      • init

        void init(long sngId,
        java.lang.String streamTokenOrPreviewUrl)
        Initializes the player. The player will enter the INITIALIZED State, and when initialization is complete it will enter the READY state.
        Parameters:
        sngId - the Id of the track to be played.
        streamTokenOrPreviewUrl - a streamToken identifying a stream / track, provided by API methods. For free accounts developpers should pass the preview url. See sample app for further details.
        See Also:
        com.deezer.sdk.network.connect.DeezerConnectInterface#authorize(android.app.Activity, String[], com.deezer.sdk.DialogListener)

      • play

        void play()
        Plays the initialized track.

      • seek

        void seek(long position)
        Seeks inside the currently playing track.
        Parameters:
        position - the desired position inside the track (in ms).

      • pause

        void pause()
        Pauses the player.

      • stop

        void stop()
        Stops the player.

      • getTrackDuration

        long getTrackDuration()
        Returns:
        the track duration (in ms).

      • getPosition

        long getPosition()
        Returns:
        the current position of the reading of the track (in ms).

      • release

        void release()
        Release all player resources. Afterwards, no method can be invoked on the player anymore.

      • isAllowedToSeek

        boolean isAllowedToSeek()
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating whether the player can seek (forward or backward) in the current track. Seek is not allowed inside radio streams.

      • setStereoVolume

        boolean setStereoVolume(float left,
                      float right)
        Sets the stereo volume of the player
        Parameters:
        left - the volume for the left channel (between 0.0 and 1.0)
        right - the volume for the right channel (between 0.0 and 1.0)
        Returns:
        if the operation succeeded
